alert.note: Alert for Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cobb County through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Smyrna, or near Marietta. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Smyrna, Powder Springs, Austell, Fair Oaks, Lithia Springs, Six Flags Over Georgia, White Water Park, Vinings, Dobbins Air Reserve Base, Jim R Miller Park and Mableton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
